intro: Sphaeralcea pannosa, commonly known as the pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Sphaeralcea pannosa is drought-tolerant and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
